channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Hundreds arrested in Turkey in protests against the detention of Istanbul's mayor
item.description: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, the top challenger to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, is accused of corruption and terror links. The opposition says Imamoglu's arrest is politically motivated.
item.content:encoded:
Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, the top challenger to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, is accused of corruption and terror links. The opposition says Imamoglu's arrest is politically motivated.

(Image credit: Francisco Seco)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says Boeing will build the new generation of fighter jets, the F-47
item.description: Trump said Boeing had won the contract to build the U.S. Air Force's next generation of fighter jets. Little is known about the jet's specifications, appearance or capabilities.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said Boeing had won the contract to build the U.S. Air Force's next generation of fighter jets. Little is known about the jet's specifications, appearance or capabilities.

(Image credit: Pool)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Pope Francis will be discharged from the hospital on Sunday, doctors say
item.description: The pontiff spent over five weeks being treated for bronchitis that evolved into a severe respiratory illness. When he returns to the Vatican, he will need to rest for two months, his doctor said.
item.content:encoded:
The pontiff spent over five weeks being treated for bronchitis that evolved into a severe respiratory illness. When he returns to the Vatican, he will need to rest for two months, his doctor said.

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Trump revokes classified access for Joe Biden, Hillary Clinton and others
item.description: While mostly symbolic, the move to revoke security clearances for over a dozen former officials has been seen as a warning to President Trump's adversaries.
item.content:encoded:
While mostly symbolic, the move to revoke security clearances for over a dozen former officials has been seen as a warning to President Trump's adversaries.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Israel strikes multiple sites in southern Lebanon in response to rocket attack
item.description: Lebanese health officials said two people were killed, including a child, and several more were injured.
item.content:encoded:
Lebanese health officials said two people were killed, including a child, and several more were injured.

(Image credit: Rabih Daher)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Where is the NCAA basketball tournament game-winning buzzer-beater?
item.description: A wider disparity between major conferences and lesser-known conferences has lent itself to fewer close games in the early rounds of both the men's and women's NCAA tournaments.
item.content:encoded:
A wider disparity between major conferences and lesser-known conferences has lent itself to fewer close games in the early rounds of both the men's and women's NCAA tournaments.

(Image credit: Jared C. Tilton)
item.dc:creator: Greg Echlin

item.title: A VA rescue effort saved 15,000 veterans' homes. Some in Congress want to scrap it
item.description: An NPR investigation uncovered 40,000 vets facing foreclosure due to a VA mistake. A rescue program is helping many of them, but others fear being left out if Congress cuts this new lifeline
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation uncovered 40,000 vets facing foreclosure due to a VA mistake. A rescue program is helping many of them, but others fear being left out if Congress cuts this new lifeline

(Image credit: Cindy Schultz for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: DHS revokes legal protections for 532,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security's new policy, revoking legal protections for hundreds of thousands, impacts people who are already in the U.S. and who came under a humanitarian parole program.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Homeland Security's new policy, revoking legal protections for hundreds of thousands, impacts people who are already in the U.S. and who came under a humanitarian parole program.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: South Sudan is 'on the brink,' U.N. warns amid renewed violence
item.description: The world's youngest country is teetering on the brink of another conflict as a regional war looms.
item.content:encoded:
The world's youngest country is teetering on the brink of another conflict as a regional war looms.

(Image credit: Jerome Delay)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Bernie Sanders is drawing record crowds as he pushes Democrats to 'fight oligarchy'
item.description: The populist message of Sen. Bernie Sanders' "Fighting Oligarchy" tour has resonated with voters frustrated by President Trump's agenda — and the Democratic Party's muddled response.
item.content:encoded:
The populist message of Sen. Bernie Sanders' "Fighting Oligarchy" tour has resonated with voters frustrated by President Trump's agenda — and the Democratic Party's muddled response.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
